 In the event of violations, the necessary measures shall be taken in their regard in accordance with the provisions of the Regulation.

## Article (15)
The private club shall be responsible before the concerned Federation and the competent authorities for all activities it is authorized to practice, and for any damages that may befall the players, the technical staff, third parties, or public facilities, without the slightest liability on the part of the Authority and the Federation in this regard.

## Article (16)
Subject to the provision of Article (59) of the aforementioned Law No. (87) of 2017:
1. A member of the board of directors of a private club may not simultaneously hold the position of a board member of a sports club, a national sports federation, or a member of the Kuwait Olympic Committee <orig>اللجنة الأولمبية الكويتية</orig> or the Kuwait Paralympic Committee <orig>اللجنة البارالمبية الكويتية</orig>.
2. It is not permissible to hold concurrent membership on the boards of directors of two private clubs that practice the same sport.
3. It is not permissible to hold ownership in two private clubs if they practice the same sport, unless the ownership percentage in one of them does not exceed 10% of the capital.

## Article (17)
If a private club loses any of the conditions for establishment or the requirements of the concerned Federations, or violates the conditions of the permit issued to it, or ceases to practice the licensed sports activity for a period of six months from the date of notifying the concerned party, the Board may grant it one or more grace periods not exceeding six months to rectify its status. If the grace period expires without rectification, the Board shall issue a decision to revoke the permit to practice the sports activity, without prejudice to the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. (1) of 2016.

## Article (18)
The Authority may suspend the activity of a private sports club for a period not exceeding six months if any of the following cases arise:
The club's board of directors or any of its employees obstructs the entry of representatives of the Authority or supervisors of the Federations, or refrains from providing the required information, or provides incorrect information.
1. The club violates any of its obligations under the provisions of this Regulation or the requirements of the concerned Federation.

## Article (19)
The permit to practice the activity shall be revoked in any of the following cases:
1. It is proven that the approval for the club's establishment was issued based on incorrect documents.
2. The club ceases to practice its activity for a period exceeding six months without the Board's approval to grant an additional period.
3. The club fails to renew the approval to practice the activity within three months of its expiration.

## Article (20)
In all cases of suspension or revocation, a written warning shall be issued to the club before the decision is made, in order to rectify the situation and remove the violation within the period specified in the warning. The competent authority shall be notified of the suspension or revocation decision immediately upon its issuance.

## Article (21)
Clubs subject to this Regulation shall be obligated to provide the Authority, within 90 days from the end of the fiscal year, with the private club's budget, detailing its revenues and expenditures. They shall also comply with the systems and laws in force in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, the Olympic Charter, and the rules of the concerned sports federations.
The club may not seek to achieve any unlawful purpose, interfere in any religious disputes, join any political, ethnic, or sectarian activity, or violate the law, public order, or public morals in the State. Furthermore, the club's members may not exploit its activities to achieve any political or religious purposes, or any form of racial discrimination.

## Article (22)
The rules governing the resolution of sports disputes arising from the practice of sports activities shall apply to private clubs. The National Authority for Sports Arbitration <orig>الهيئة الوطنية للتحكيم الرياضي</orig> – established under the aforementioned Law No. (87) of 2017 – shall have jurisdiction to adjudicate all disputes arising from the application of the provisions of this Regulation.

## Article (23)
A committee shall be formed by a decision of the Director General of the Authority <orig>مدير عام الهيئة</orig>, to be named the "Grievances Committee <orig>لجنة التظلمات</orig>". It shall consist of legal, financial, and technical members and shall be responsible for examining grievances submitted regarding measures taken in accordance with the provisions of this Regulation. The committee's recommendations shall be presented to the Director General of the Authority <orig>مدير عام الهيئة</orig> for a decision. The decision to form the committee shall specify its working system and the procedures for submitting and examining grievances.

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Resolution No. P.A.I. (253) of 2025
### Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty

The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A2-179), issued on 2/10/2024, which states that Baytna Waste Treatment Company <orig>شركة بيتنا لمعالجة النفايات</orig> committed the following violation:
– The plot is closed.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (4/2025/498) held on 5/2/2025.
- And based on the submission of the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
And in the public interest.

**It is decided**
**(Article One)**
To warn / Baytna Waste Treatment Company <orig>شركة بيتنا لمعالجة النفايات</orig>.
Located in the South Amghara <orig>جنوب امغرة</orig> area – Block (1) – Plot (1) – not to repeat the violation mentioned above. In the event of a repeat violation, more severe measures will be taken in accordance with the rules in force in this regard.

**(Article Two)**
This resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Resolution No. P.A.I. (265) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (A3-185), issued on 21/1/2025, which states that Mr. Mubarak Abdulaziz Al-Hasawi <orig>مبارك عبد العزيز الحساوي</orig> committed the following violation:
– Engaging in industrial activity without a license and having unlicensed workers' housing.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (4/2025/498) held on 5/2/2025.
- And based on the submission of the Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services.
And in the public interest.

**It is decided**
**(Article One)**
To close / Plot No. (1) located in the First Al-Mirqab Industrial Area <orig>منطقة المرقاب الصناعية الأولى</orig> (Block) – Parcel (3) – belonging to Mr. Mubarak Abdulaziz Al-Hasawi <orig>مبارك عبدالعزيز الحساوي</orig> – until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.

**(Article Two)**
In the event the violation is not removed within (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

**(Article Three)**
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>

Issued on: 12 August 2025

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement
### Issuance of Tender No. (A.D./H/662)
**Operation and Maintenance Works for Kuwait Motor Town <orig>مدينة الكويت لرياضة المحركات</orig>**
The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the issuance of Tender (A.D./H/662) for the Operation and Maintenance Works for Kuwait Motor Town <orig>مدينة الكويت لرياضة المحركات</orig>. Companies or institutions specialized in this field who wish to participate may obtain the booklet of conditions and tender documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department) during official working hours, starting from the date of this announcement's publication in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (1,000 K.D.) only one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (payment via K-Net only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon presentation of the relevant certificate). This is available from 8:30 AM to 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 12/10/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids shall be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- A preliminary deposit (bid bond) of (54,000 K.D.) must be submitted in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from a Kuwaiti bank, valid for the duration of the bid's validity, which is (90) days.
4- A valid certificate of fulfillment of the national labor percentage must be submitted.
5- An authorization letter and a copy of the Civil ID of the company's representative for purchasing the tender document.
6- This public tender is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter attached with a copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for the duration(s) it deems appropriate to complete the awarding procedures.
9- The site visit is scheduled for Thursday, 2/10/2025, at 10:00 AM at Kuwait Motor Town <orig>مدينة الكويت لرياضة المحركات</orig>.
10- The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Sunday, 5/10/2025, at 10:00 AM at Kuwait Motor Town <orig>مدينة الكويت لرياضة المحركات</orig>.
For inquiries, please contact:
- Direct: 22011434 – 22011426

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Correction
A material error occurred in the publication of Decisions 305/2025, 306/2025, and 349/2025, published in Issue 1757 dated 21/9/2025.
The error was in the date of issuance of the decision.
Therefore, we are republishing after correcting the error.

## Decision No. P.A.I. (305) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot
The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed: -
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry to sign the penalties of warning and closure for violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Quarry Areas Department No. (302), issued on 18/08/2025, which includes the commission by the occupant of Plot No. (723) of the following violations:
- Constructing buildings without a license.
- Encroachment outside the plot boundaries by an area of 200 meters.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Specifications and Industrial Services, and for the public interest.
**Has Decided**
**(Article One)**
The closure of Plot No. (723) located in the South Amghara <orig>جنوب امغره</orig> area – Block (1) until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.
**(Article Two)**
In the event the violation is not removed within (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
**(Article Three)**
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry
Issued on: August 19, 2025 AD

# Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
## Re-issuance of Practice
## Announcement and Invitation for Practice
## No. Q A (10-2024/2025)
Regarding the Inspection Devices Management Program for the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
The Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> announces the conduct of a practice for the execution of the aforementioned works and invites all who meet the conditions mentioned in the Public Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 and its executive regulations, and the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> Circular No. (5) of 2020 regarding procurement systems in public entities, provided that the practitioner is a company or institution classified by the Central Agency for Information Technology <orig>الجهاز المركزي لتكنولوجيا المعلومات</orig> in the same field.
The practice documents can be obtained from the General Services Department – Tenders Preparation and Follow-up Section, 10th floor, at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> in Al-Riq'i <orig>الرقعي</orig>, Plot 2, Street 106.

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Fees for Practice No. Q A (10-2024/2025)</table_caption>
<table>
| Bid Receipt Start | Bid Submission Deadline | Initial Insurance | Guarantee | Tender Booklet Value |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| 28/09/2025 | 16/10/2025 | 525 K.D. | Valid for 90 days | 50 K.D. |
| Preliminary Meeting | 10:30 AM on Sunday, 05/10/2025, in the meeting hall attached to the office of the Deputy Director General for Human and Financial Resources <orig>نائب المدير العام للموارد البشرية والمالية</orig> on the 11th floor at the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>. |
</table>

Bids are to be submitted at the headquarters of the General Services Department, 10th floor, located at the headquarters of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> in Al-Riq'i <orig>الرقعي</orig>, Plot 2, Street 106. Any bid received after this deadline will not be considered. A purchase authorization letter, a copy of the civil ID, and the company's documents must be provided.
- The aforementioned cash consideration is to be paid via K-Net card.
- The final time for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on the day specified above. A bid submission authorization and a copy of the civil ID must be provided.
- A certificate of national labor percentage, valid for one year from the bid submission date, must be provided.
- The applicant for the practice must review the practice documents and submit all questions and inquiries related to the practice in writing during the preliminary meeting. No inquiries will be accepted thereafter. In the event that any applicant for the practice is absent, they will be obligated to implement all items agreed upon during the preliminary meeting without the right to recourse against the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for any financial claims or additional time periods.
- Attendance at the preliminary meeting requires bringing the following: -
  1. The original purchase receipt.
  2. An authorization to attend and a copy of the authorized person's civil ID.
- Bid envelopes will be opened on Sunday, 19/10/2025, at 1:30 PM at the location specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of the bidders or their representatives.
- The practice is indivisible, alternative offers are not accepted, and it follows a single-envelope system (technical and financial).
- Bids shall be valid for 90 days from the closing date. The initial guarantee is (525) K.D. and must be valid for the entire duration of the bid in the name of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
- For more information, please visit the website of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> on the World Wide Web.

Director General of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>المدير العام للهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>

- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Specifications and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>, and in the public interest.

**Decision**
(Article One)
Closure of plots Nos. (713/714) located in the South Amghara <orig>جنوب امغره</orig> area – Block (1) until the violations and their resulting effects are removed.
(Article Two)
In the event the violation is not removed after the passing of (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
(Article Three)
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالإنابة</orig>

Issued on 19 August 2025 AD

# Decision No. H A S (349) of 2025
## Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty
The Acting Director General <orig>المدير العام بالتكليف</orig>
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 concerning the issuance of the Industry Law, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose the penalties of warning and closure on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Industrial Inspection Department No. (387-A1), issued on 13/4/2025, which includes the commission by / Dalida Holding Company for Company Activities, Real Estate Ownership, and Permitted Contracting <orig>شركة داليدا القابضة لأنشطة الشركات وتملك العقارات والمقاولات المسموح بها</orig> – of the following violation:
  - The plot is unutilized and vacant of any activity.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations in its meeting No. (6/2025/500) held on 27/04/2025.
- And based on the presentation by the Deputy Director General for Specifications and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>, and in the public interest.

**Decision**
(Article One)
Warning / Dalida Holding Company for Company Activities, Real Estate Ownership, and Permitted Contracting <orig>شركة داليدا القابضة لأنشطة الشركات وتملك العقارات والمقاولات المسموح بها</orig>.
Located in the Shuwaikh Industrial Area 2 <orig>الشويخ الصناعية الثانية</orig> – Block (H) – Plot (77) – of the necessity to remove the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (one month). In the event the violation is not removed, more severe measures will be taken in accordance with the rules in force in this regard.
(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>مدير عام الهيئة العامة للصناعة بالتكليف</orig>

4. The amount of the initial guarantee is not less than 2% of the total value of the tender bid. This guarantee must be valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity, in the form of a certified check or an unconditional letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited Kuwaiti banks in favor of the Ministry of Public Works <orig>وزارة الأشغال العامة</orig>. The bidder may not claim any interest on the amount of this guarantee.
The amount of the final guarantee is: at least 10% of the total value of the contract, in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee, free of any reservations, issued by one of the accredited Kuwaiti banks in favor of the Ministry. The creditor (Second Party) may not seize the guarantee amount, and no interest shall be paid on it.

## Announcement
The owners of the company: Al-Dairah Al-Muttahidah for General Trading and Contracting <orig>الدائرة المتحدة للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig> have submitted
a request to the Department of Partnerships at the Ministry <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص بالوزارة</orig> to carry out: an amendment of the legal entity from a limited liability company <orig>شركة ذات مسؤولية محدودة</orig> to the new legal entity of a general partnership company <orig>شركة تضامنية</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to approach the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued liability of the joint partners <orig>الشركاء المتضامنين</orig>, in the case of a general partnership <orig>التضامنية</orig> or simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only, towards this creditor, until their objection is decided by a final judgment <orig>حكم نهائي</orig>.

# United Networks K.S.C. (Closed)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of United Networks K.S.C. (Closed) was held on Tuesday, August 19, 2025, at eleven-thirty in the morning at the company's headquarters located in Al-Salmiya <orig>السالمية</orig> - Salem Al-Mubarak Street - Dalal Complex - Sixth Floor.
The meeting was attended by:
1- Mr. Mohammed Abdullah Al-Habil <orig>محمد عبد الله الحبيل</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors.
2- Mr. Ali Owaid Rakhees <orig>علي عويد رخيص</orig>, from Al-Waha Auditing Office <orig>مكتب الواحة لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>.
3- The company's shareholders or their representatives.
4- Mr. Antoine Bechara <orig>أنطوان بشارة</orig>, Secretary.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mohammed Abdullah Al-Habil <orig>محمد عبد الله الحبيل</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors.
After announcing the completion of the quorum for the session with an attendance of 100% of the company's total shares, the agenda items were discussed, and the Extraordinary General Assembly made the following decisions by unanimous vote of the shares present:
1) Based on incurring losses exceeding three-quarters of the company's capital, the Extraordinary General Assembly resolved to continue the company's operations in accordance with Article 271 of the Companies Law No. 1 of 2016.
2) The Extraordinary General Assembly resolved to reduce the authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. 10,000,000 (ten million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to K.D. 1,100,000 (one million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) by an amount of K.D. 8,900,000 (eight million nine hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) to offset part of the accumulated losses after using the entire share premium for the fiscal year ending on 31/12/2024, leaving a balance of K.D. 716,741 (seven hundred sixteen thousand seven hundred forty-one Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
Approval to amend Article (5) of the Articles of Association and Article (6) of the Memorandum of Association of the company as follows:
(Text before amendment)
"The company's capital is set at K.D. 10,000,000 (ten million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into one hundred million shares, with a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares."
(Text after amendment)
"The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital is set at K.D. 1,100,000 (one million one hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) divided into 11,000,000 shares, with a value of one hundred fils per share, and all shares are cash shares."
The meeting concluded at eleven fifty a.m.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Mali L.Y. for Direct Trading in Currencies, Metals, and Commodities K.S.C. (Closed)
## Minutes of the Board of Directors Meeting
The Board of Directors of Mali L.Y. for Direct Trading in Currencies, Metals, and Commodities K.S.C. (Closed) ("the Company"), Kuwait, held its meeting at ten o'clock in the morning at the company's headquarters, with the following Board members in attendance:
1. Mr. Meshal Mufleh Hamoud Adbis Al-Rashidi <orig>مشعل مفلح حمود ادبيس الرشيدي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors
2. Mr. Mufleh Hamoud Mufleh Adbis Al-Rashidi <orig>مفلح حمود مفلح ادبيس الرشيدي</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors
3. Mrs. Dalal Falah Hamoud Mufleh Dubais Al-Rashidi <orig>دلال فلاح حمود مفلح دبيس الرشيدي</orig>, Member of the Board of Directors
4. Mr. Mohamed Sayed Farrag Ghoneim <orig>محمد سيد فراج غنيم</orig>, Secretary
The session was opened, and the following took place:
Item One: Discussion of the completion of the company's capital.
Resolution: Approval to complete the company's capital by an amount of (500,000) five hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, bringing the total company capital to (1,000,000) one million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
Item Two: Determining the mechanism and steps for capital completion.
Resolution: The capital shall be completed by the company's current shareholders.
Item Three: Authorizing the concerned parties to complete the official procedures.
Resolution: To authorize Mr. Meshal Mufleh Hamoud Adbis Al-Rashidi <orig>مشعل مفلح حمود ادبيس الرشيدي</orig>, in his capacity as (Chairman of the Board of Directors), to take all necessary legal and administrative measures before the official authorities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>.
Before the end of the meeting, the Chairman of the meeting thanked the attendees, and the Board of Directors meeting was concluded at ten-thirty in the morning on the same day.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Asia Holding Company
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting (Postponed)
### Held on Wednesday, September 17, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly (Postponed) of the shareholders of Asia Holding Company K.S.C. (Closed) held its meeting at ten o'clock in the morning on Wednesday, September 17, 2025, at the main headquarters of Al-Safat Group of Companies – Al-Safat Tower – Hawally – Beirut Street – Seventeenth Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Saheb Saleh Khajah <orig>صاحب صالح خاجه</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The meeting was also attended by:
- Shareholders holding 93,560,483 shares by proxy, representing 59.425% of the total shares of the company's capital.
After Mr. Saheb Saleh Khajah <orig>صاحب صالح خاجه</orig> announced that the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, he then proceeded to present the items on the agenda for discussion, and the following was resolved:-
Item One: A discussion was held regarding the reduction of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 15,744,248 to 2,143,759 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> by canceling 13,600,489 shares at a nominal value of 100 fils per share, to amortize the accumulated losses amounting to KWD 13,856,241, in accordance with the audited financial statements for the fiscal year ending on December 31, 2024, according to the following steps:
1. Amortizing part of the accumulated losses with the voluntary reserve in the amount of KWD 127,122.
2. Amortizing part of the accumulated losses with the statutory reserve in the amount of KWD 128,630.
3. Amortizing the remainder of the accumulated losses amounting to (KWD 13,600,489) from the company's capital.
The Board of Directors was authorized to dispose of any fractional shares. Accordingly, it was approved. Approved by (100%).
Item Two: Approval was granted to amend Article No. 6 of the Memorandum of Association and Article No. 5 of the Articles of Association related to the capital, to become as follows:
Text before Amendment:
"The company's capital is set at KWD 15,744,248 (fifteen million, seven hundred forty-four thousand, two hundred and forty-eight Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 157,442,480 shares (one hundred fifty-seven million, four hundred forty-two thousand, four hundred and eighty shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are in cash."
Text after Amendment
"The authorized, issued, and paid-up capital of the company is set at KWD 2,143,759 (two million, one hundred forty-three thousand, seven hundred and fifty-nine Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into 21,437,590 shares (twenty-one million, four hundred thirty-seven thousand, five hundred and ninety shares), with a value of 100 Kuwaiti fils per share, and all shares are in cash."
At the conclusion of the meeting, Mr. Saheb Saleh Khajah <orig>صاحب صالح خاجه</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, thanked the attendees, and the proceedings of the Ordinary General Assembly meeting were concluded at ten-thirty in the morning.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Al-Mutakamila for Heavy Loads Company (K.S.C.C.) - Under Liquidation
## Held on 17/9/2025
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Al-Mutakamila for Heavy Loads Company (K.S.C.C.) was held on Sunday, 17/9/2025, at 11:30 AM at the company's headquarters, in the presence of shareholders owning 19,800,000 shares, representing 99% of the company's capital, and in the presence of the Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Saleh Suleiman Saleh Al-Huweidi <orig>صالح سليمان صالح الهويدي</orig>, and Ms. Rania Yousef Al-Nasser <orig>رانيا يوسف الناصر</orig> from the Gulf Clearing Company. The Chairman of the General Assembly began in the name of God, welcoming the attendees and announcing the attendance percentage, then proceeded to review the agenda as follows:
1- The company's Extraordinary General Assembly discussed the item listed on the extraordinary agenda and unanimously adopted the following resolutions:
- Unanimous approval to continue with the dissolution and liquidation of the company.
- Appointment of Mr. Khalid Mohammed Hoshan Al-Majed <orig>خالد محمد هوشان الماجد</orig> as the company's liquidator.
- The liquidation period is one year.
- The liquidator's fees are KWD 1,000 (one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars).
Chairman of the Board of Directors

The purposes for which the company was established are as follows: -

Chairman of the Board of Directors

Ordinary as follows: -
Approval was given to amend the text of Article (16) and the text of Article (17) of the company's Articles of Association as follows: -
**Article (16) Current Text:**
A member of the Board of Directors must not have been convicted of a crime prejudicial to honor, and must own in his personal capacity, or the legal person he represents must own, a number of shares with a value of not less than 7,500 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or 1% of the capital, whichever is less. If the member, at the time of his election, does not own or represent this number of shares, he must acquire them within one month of his election, otherwise his membership will be forfeited. The legal person shall be responsible for the actions of its representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders.
**Proposed Text:**
A candidate for membership of the Board of Directors must meet the following conditions:
1- To have the legal capacity to act.
2- Not to have been previously convicted of a felony with a penalty restricting freedom, or a crime of bankruptcy by default or fraud, or a crime prejudicial to honor or trust, or a penalty restricting freedom for violating the provisions of this law, unless he has been rehabilitated.
3- With the exception of independent board members, he must own, in a personal capacity, or the person he represents must own, a number of the company's shares.
4- Any other conditions mentioned in the Memorandum of Association.
If a member of the Board of Directors loses any of the preceding conditions or other conditions stipulated in this law or other laws, his membership status shall cease from the date of losing that condition.
**Article (17) Current Text:**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and deals concluded with or for the account of the company, except with a license from the General Assembly. None of them may participate in the management of a similar or competing company. The Chairman of the Board or any of its members—even if representing a legal person—may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain a benefit for himself or for others, nor may he sell or buy the company's shares throughout his term of membership on the Board of Directors.
**Proposed Text:**
The Chairman of the Board of Directors or any member of this Board may not have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and deals concluded with or for the account of the company, except with a license from the General Assembly. None of them may participate in the management of a similar or competing company. The Chairman of the Board or any of its members—even if representing a legal person—may not exploit information obtained by virtue of his position to gain a benefit for himself or for others. The Chairman of the Board or any of the members of the Board of Directors may dispose of their owned shares, whether by selling or buying, during their term of membership on the Board of Directors.
All the above-listed items have been approved.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

### General Guidelines for Bidders:
1. The tender (general) is open to bidders accredited by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> to carry out the works subject of the tender.
2. Bidders for this tender must be specialized companies/institutions (within Kuwait) in carrying out all works subject of the tender, registered in the Commercial Register and the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> for the current year. The bidding companies must have prior experience in this field and possess the capabilities and specialized, trained technical labor to execute the works subject of the tender.
3. This tender is indivisible and pertains to the execution of all works subject of the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and the schedule of items, numbers, quantities, and prices. The bidder is not entitled to submit alternative bids (tenders), as the tender documents do not permit the submission of alternative bids (tenders), and must adhere to what is stated in the documents and records of this tender in this regard.
4. The bidder must submit with their bid a preliminary deposit in the amount of KWD 2,000 (only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) in the form of a certified check or an unconditional and irrevocable letter of guarantee, free of any reservations, issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait in their name and for the benefit of the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>. This deposit must be valid for the duration of the bid's validity. Any bid not accompanied by the full deposit will be excluded. Preliminary deposits shall not be returned until after the passage of (90) days from the tender closing date or when the winning bidder submits the final deposit and signs the contract, unless the tender is canceled. The Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this deposit, and the bidder's creditors may not seize this amount.
5. The total duration of the contract is (36 months), during which the contractor is obligated to execute all works subject of the tender in accordance with the general and special conditions, technical specifications, and the schedule of items, numbers, quantities, and prices, as per the general and special conditions, provisions, and technical specifications contained in the tender documents.
6. The bid shall remain in effect and irrevocable from the time of its submission for a period of (90 days) from the date of opening the bid envelopes. No price adjustments will be accepted after the bid is submitted. If it is not possible to decide on the bids within the specified validity period, bidders will be asked to accept the extension of their bids' validity for another similar period at most. Each must agree in writing to the extension and specify the duration of the preliminary deposit. The bid of anyone who does not accept the extension of its validity period will be excluded.
7. If, upon studying the tender, the bidder finds any error, deficiency, or discrepancy in the technical documents or in the schedule of quantities that may affect the bid categories or the value of the works, they must seek clarification from the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig> before submitting their bid. The Ministry will study these observations and inquiries if they are serious and answer them during the preliminary meeting, and will correct any error, deficiency, discrepancy, or conflict (if any), or will circulate the clarification and response in a letter addressed to every bidder who purchased the tender documents. The response in this case shall be considered an integral part of those tender documents. In all cases, this shall not result in any additional responsibility or obligation on the part of the Ministry.
8. Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the headquarters of the Procurement and Warehousing Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> (in the South Subhan area <orig>منطقة صبحان الجنوبي</orig>) no later than 15 working days, during official working hours and before twelve o'clock noon on the closing day. Any bid received after the aforementioned deadline will not be considered, nor will any change, modification, or reduction in the prices of the submitted bids received after the bid has been submitted.
9. The fee for obtaining a copy of the tender documents is (KWD 75).
10. A preliminary meeting will be held to answer the inquiries of the bidders at the headquarters of the Procurement and Warehousing Department <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> (in the South Subhan area <orig>منطقة صبحان الجنوبي</orig>). The date of the meeting will be determined and announced later on the Ministry's official website.
11. The bidder must fill out the attached schedules and provide a statement of all supplies necessary for the execution of the works within the same bid documents submitted. The Ministry has the right not to accept the bid if it does not include the filled-out schedule, in accordance with the public interest, with the necessity of adhering to the technical specifications and conditions of the tender.
12. The bidder must submit all bank guarantees related to this tender in the Arabic language.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Education <orig>وكيل وزارة التربية</orig>

# Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Tender No. (L. Sh. 2025/63-2026) for the supply, installation, and operation of an X-ray machine for the Forensic Evidence Department of the Central Operations General Directorate at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Companies/institutions specialized in this field should visit the General Directorate of Financial Affairs – Tenders Department (in Ardiya Industrial Area) to obtain the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of KWD 20 (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), payable via K-Net. A preliminary guarantee of KWD 400 (four hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only) must be submitted with the financial bid for the tender. Note that the final insurance for the tender is 10% of the total contract value. Applicants must bring a copy of the tender announcement from the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and the following documents:
- A valid registration receipt from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Or
- A registration application to the Ministry, followed by the purchase of the tender documents.
The closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 15/10/2025, from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee of the Purchasing Committee in the Sharq area – Al-Siddiq School – First Floor.

## First: Description of the Property According to the Attached Certificate of Descriptions:
The property of Document No. 4161/1966, located in the Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig> area, Plot No. 74, Block No. 7, Model 3 of Plan M/2/2/1-8, with an area of 750 m², to be sold by public auction with a base price of KWD 1,305,000 (one million, three hundred and five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

** Stated in the Certificate of Descriptions:
The property consists of a ground floor and a first floor, as of the date of inspection.

** And according to the expert's report:
In the session of 26/10/2023, we proceeded to the disputed property located in the Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig> area, Block 7 - Jassim Hamad Al-Saqr Street - Plot No. 74 - House 35 - Automated No. 10402046, in the presence and under the guidance of the thirteenth plaintiff from the first list in person. The remaining plaintiffs and all defendants failed to attend despite being notified of the scheduled date. Also present from the department was the appointed knowledge expert, Mr. Faisal Abdulmohsen Al-Sharhan <orig>فيصل عبد المحسن الشرهان</orig>, at the time of the inspection, as follows:
1. The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. (4161/1966), with an area of 750 m², pursuant to a sales contract issued by the Government of Kuwait <orig>حكومة الكويت</orig> and submitted in the plaintiffs' document portfolio dated 18/10/2023, document No. 13.
2- The disputed property is a house overlooking one street and is bordered by neighbors on three sides.
3- The disputed property is very old, and the knowledge expert stated that it is dilapidated.
4- The disputed property consists of a ground floor and a roof, detailed as follows:
- The ground floor consists of (7) rooms + (2) bathrooms + a kitchen + an open courtyard.
- The roof consists of (2) rooms + a bathroom.
5- There is no air conditioning in the house.
6- The exterior cladding of the property is painted spray plaster, parts of which are falling off.
7- The property was uninhabited at the time of inspection, as it is abandoned and the windows have no glass.
8- We took photographs of the disputed property.
9- The knowledge expert appointed by the department inspected the property in preparation for assessing its value, determining the base price of the property, and submitting the relevant report.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be ruled in their favor, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the execution procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request and responsibility of those initiating the sale procedures, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The winning bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the winning bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Deputy President of the Court of First Instance <orig>نائب رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

This is in execution of the court judgment issued in Case No. 725/2024 Sales/4.

After inspection and verification, the expert found the following:

### General Description of the Disputed Property

The property subject of the lawsuit is located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block 6, Street 4, at Plot No. 184, House 47. The property is situated on a single street, bordered by neighbors on both sides, with an alleyway at the back and a setback consisting of parking for 6 cars. The exterior cladding of the disputed property is a white Sigma finish. The property consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof. It has 3 main iron entrances, and there is an elevator. The air conditioning system consists entirely of individual units.

### Specific Description of the Disputed Property

With the guidance of the fifth and sixth defendants, the expert inspected the interior of the property. The ground floor consists of 3 halls, a diwaniya, a storage room, a room, two bathrooms, a maid's room with its bathroom, and a main kitchen. The first floor is composed of two parts. The fifth defendant stated that the first part of the first floor consists of 3 rooms and a hall and is utilized by the first and ninth defendants and the second plaintiff, although the second plaintiff moved out approximately a year ago. As for the second part of the first floor, the expert knocked on the door, and the eighth defendant responded and allowed the expert to inspect the part he utilizes, which consists of a hall, two bathrooms, a bedroom, a dressing room, a kitchen, a laundry room, and a bathroom attached to that room. The second floor is also composed of two parts. The first part belongs to the sixth defendant and consists of two rooms, a bathroom, and a kitchen. As for the second part of the second floor, the expert knocked on the door, and the seventh defendant responded and provided access to the part he independently occupies, which consists of a hall, a kitchen, two rooms, and two bathrooms. The fifth defendant stated that he, along with the second, third, and fourth defendants and the first plaintiff, do not utilize the property. The expert appraiser <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> recorded the general and specific descriptions of the property in preparation for estimating its value and the value of the quarter/usufruct.

## Second: Auction Conditions:

**First:** The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.

**Second:** The person whose bid is accepted by the judge must deposit the full accepted price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.

**Third:** If the person whose bid was accepted does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at his liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale had been awarded.

**Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award will be confirmed for him, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.

**Fifth:** If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at his liability, based on the price that had been awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the price of the property.

**Sixth:** The winning bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for ownership transfer and registration, the expenses of the enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

**Seventh:** This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.

**Eighth:** The winning bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any claim of ignorance.

**Notice:**
1- This sale announcement is published in the official gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the winning bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a rent equivalent to that of similar properties."

Deputy President of the Court of First Instance <orig>نائب رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
- A share of 14.432% of the property under Document No. 10501/2018, located in Fahaheel <orig>الفحيحيل</orig> – Block No. 112 – Plot 8 – from Plan No. M/26897 – with an area of 600 m², with a base price of KWD 38,927.433 (Thirty-eight thousand nine hundred twenty-seven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and 433 fils).
*Inspection:
In the session of 5/2/2024, the disputed property was visited and inspected on-site in the presence and under the guidance of the plaintiff's agent, and in the absence of the other parties despite their proper notification. With the assistance of the expert appraiser, the inspection was conducted as follows:
- The disputed property is located in the Fahaheel <orig>الفحيحيل</orig> area, Block 10, Street 12, Plot 11208, Building 40, PACI No. 13784377.
- The disputed property is a government house consisting of two and a half floors, located on a single street.
- The exterior cladding of the property is beige Sigma.
- We were unable to enter the property and inspect it from the inside.
- The expert appraiser estimated the total value of the disputed property through an external inspection, taking into account the location and condition of the property at the time of inspection.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction begins at the base price indicated for the property. To participate in the auction, a payment of at least one-fifth of that price is required, either by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Directorate at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding is reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the bidding is immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."

Consequently, the net amount due to Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haider Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> becomes 1,066,089.63 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (one million, sixty-six thousand, eighty-nine Kuwaiti dinars and sixty-three fils) after deducting the debit balance due from him as of December 31, 2023.
In accordance with the court's decision regarding the appointment of the expert dated November 23, 2023, which was to estimate the value of only one share, we have valued the company and determined the value of the single share for Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haider Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig>. The matter is left to the court to consider other documents and rulings.
This valuation is subject to the assumptions and limiting conditions presented in the attached sections of this report. The valuation summary should be read in conjunction with the detailed valuation report presented in the following pages.

# 5. Valuation
## 5.1 Valuation Approaches / Methods
- There are three traditional valuation approaches: the income approach, the market approach, and the cost or asset approach. Professionals differ on the classification or identification of valuation methods within these three types. However, it is generally agreed that all valuation methods can be described as one of these approaches, a combination of two, or more of these approaches.

### 5.1.1 Income Approach
- The income approach is based on the economic principle of expectation. In this approach, the value of the investment subject to valuation is the present value of the economic income expected to be generated by the investment. For valuation purposes, the measure of economic income being analyzed can be defined in several ways.

### 5.1.2 Market Approach
- The market approach is a method of determining an indication of the value of a business, ownership interest, security, or intangible asset by using one or more methods that compare the subject to similar businesses, ownership interests, securities, or intangible assets that have been sold. Generally, this can be accomplished by comparison with publicly traded companies or by analyzing actual transactions of similar sold businesses. It may also include analyzing previous transactions in the company's shares (if any).

### 5.3.1 Asset Approach
- The asset approach is based on the value of net assets less liabilities, as it is commonly used. This approach starts with the balance sheet book values as close as possible to the valuation date, and the assets and liabilities, including unrecorded ones, are restated to fair value.
Different valuation methods involving one or more of the three categories of valuation approaches can be used. In any valuation study, all applicable methods must be considered, and the most proven method or methods for valuing the property subject to valuation and appropriate for the valuation study should be selected.

## 5.2 The Selected Approach/Method
- The valuation approach we have adopted to determine the fair value of the equity in the company is the Asset Approach (Net Asset Value Method). This is because Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading & Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ. م. م</orig> has no current operating elements, and its value lies in its net assets and current investments.

Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be repeated at his liability in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award shall be adjudicated to him, unless someone comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at his liability based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the sale price of the shares.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for amending the company's contract, the expenses of the execution procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>200 د.ك</orig>, lawyer's and expert's fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.
Eighth: The partners have the right to object to the admission of the bidder who submitted the best offer within three days from the date the court approves his bid.
Ninth: The company and any of the partners may, even before the judgment awarding the auction is issued, settle the debt of the debtor partner owed to the seizing creditor.
Tenth: The company may, even before the judgment awarding the auction is issued, redeem a portion of the seized shares sufficient to satisfy the creditor's debt.
Eleventh: In the event that any of the partners object to the admission of the successful bidder to the company, and neither the company nor the partners settle the debt of the seizing creditor or redeem the shares as previously described, the sales judge shall issue a judgment for the dissolution and liquidation of the company and appoint a liquidator. The judgment issued in this regard may be appealed in accordance with the law.
Important Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- Those wishing to participate in the auction may review the company's financial statements, as concluded in the report of the appointed expert in the case, at the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة كتاب المحكمة الكلية</orig>. This must be done no later than the day before the scheduled auction session.

Vice President of the Court of First Instance <orig>نائب رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

# Announcement of Public Auction for the Sale of a Property
The Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, to be held on Wednesday, 22/10/2025, in Hall 5 on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice at 9:00 AM. This is in execution of the court judgment issued in Case No. 659/2023 Sales/2.
Filed by: Hanan Khaled Abdulrahman Al-Musfir <orig>حنان خالد عبدالرحمن المسفر</orig>.
Against: 1- Fahad Abdulrahman Abdulaziz Al-Duwaish <orig>فهد عبدالرحمن عبدالعزيز الدويش</orig>.
2- Director General of the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, in his capacity.
3- Director General of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, in his capacity.
4- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Registration Affairs, in his capacity.
Description of the First Property: As stated in the Municipality's description certificate.
The entire property under Document No. 2954/2016, located in the Qortuba <orig>قرطبة</orig> area – Plot (472), Block No. (1), Plan M/32992 – with an area of 432 m², will be sold at public auction with a base price of KWD 720,000 (Seven hundred and twenty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
The description certificate states:
The property is a private residence consisting of (basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor + roof). The property is non-compliant and in violation of the Municipality's regulations and bylaws, with the following violations:
1- There are architectural and structural modifications on the second floor.
2- Ledges have been added to all windows.
3- A staircase has been added outside the ground floor boundaries.
** According to the expert's report
The disputed property is located in the (Qortuba <orig>قرطبة</orig>) area – Block (1) – Street (1) – Avenue (2) – House (24). The inspection was conducted as follows:
- The disputed property conforms in its general and specific specifications to Document No. 2954/2016, with an area of 432 m².
- The disputed property is a private residence located on an internal street (corner plot) and is bordered by neighbors on two sides.
The disputed property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, and a roof, detailed as follows:
- The basement consists of a large hall divided into four rooms with gypsum board + a bathroom + washbasins + 2 rooms + a storage room.
- The ground floor consists of a hall + a dining room + a bathroom and washbasins + an annex consisting of a kitchen, a storage room, a laundry room, a bathroom, and a maid's room.
- The first floor consists of a hall + 2 master bedrooms + 1 room with a bathroom.
- The second floor consists of a hall, a master bedroom, 2 rooms + a bathroom + a kitchen + a maid's room with its bathroom.
- The roof consists of a room for heaters and an elevator room.
- The exterior of the property is clad with Sigma.
- The property has central air conditioning.
- The property has an elevator that is not operational.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Enforcement Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, in addition to expenses and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless another person comes forward in that session who agrees to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for title transfer and registration, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease agreement in their favor for a comparable rent."
Deputy President of the Court of First Instance

Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction is immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees during the sale session.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction will be reopened at their liability in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in this session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction will be reopened in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the auction will be immediately reopened at their liability based on the price that was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid will be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder will be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law and at the request of those initiating the sale procedures and at their own responsibility, without the Clerks' Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>إدارة الكتاب بالمحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the Official Gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to draft a lease contract in their favor for a similar rent."

Deputy President of the Court of First Instance
