## Property Description
1- The property has an area of 1000m², consistent with the deed.
2- The property subject of the lawsuit is a private residence (with front and back access), with a side alley and an unpaved yard, and is bordered by neighbors on both sides.
3- The door was knocked on and the intervening party was contacted by phone. He stated that he would open the door, and he did.
4- The property is an old private residence consisting of a ground floor, a first floor, a roof, and an annex.
5- The ground floor consists of two (2) bedrooms + a bathroom + three (3) living rooms + a bathroom + an indoor kitchen + an outdoor kitchen.
6- The annex consists of a room + a bathroom.
7- The first floor consists of a living room + a bathroom + a kitchen + two (2) rooms + a bathroom + two (2) rooms.
8- The roof has no structures on it.
*The Expert Appraiser <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property and took all necessary notes in preparation for estimating the value of the property subject of the lawsuit and the value of the consideration for use from the date of the death of the parties' mother on 13/6/2018, according to the prevailing price in the real estate market.

### Property Description According to the Attached Certificate of Description:
The property under Deed No. 7096/2005, located in the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area (currently) – formerly Al-Qurain B2 <orig>القرين ب 2</orig> – Plot No. 216, Block 2, from Plan No. M/36950, with an area of 400.20 m² (four hundred square meters and twenty percent of a square meter), described as a private residence, to be sold at public auction with a base price of (400,000 K.D.) four hundred thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** Stated in the Certificate of Description:
The property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and part of a second floor, and the property conforms to the plans.
** And according to the Expert's Report:
On the session of 6/5/2024, we, accompanied by the Expert Appraiser <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> from the Administration, Mr. Sami Al-Tarawneh <orig>سامي الطراورة</orig>, went to the Al-Qusour <orig>القصور</orig> area, Block (2), Street (15), House (25), with automated number (13240337), in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff, while the defendants were absent. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The disputed property is a government house with an area of (400.20 m²), located on two streets and a side alley, with a setback clad in pink-colored stone.
- The house consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof.
- The ground floor consists of a kitchen, a dining room, two living rooms, and two bathrooms, one of which has washbasins. One of the living rooms has central air conditioning, while the rest of the floor has unit-based systems.
- The first floor consists of (5) rooms, (2) bathrooms, and a small corridor. The air conditioning for the entire floor is unit-based.
- The roof consists of a room, a bathroom, and a large storage room.
The property conforms to Deed No. 7096 dated 4/2/2005 in terms of specifications.
The Expert Appraiser <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took all his notes on the property and stated that he will submit his report to estimate the market value of the disputed property.

## Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall begin at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from a bank in favor of the Execution Department at the Ministry of Justice <orig>إدارة التنفيذ بوزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The person whose bid is approved by the judge must deposit, during the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, he must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be repeated at his own risk during the same session, based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the following session, the auction award shall be ruled in his favor, unless another person comes forward in this session who agrees to purchase with an increase of one-tenth, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be repeated in the same session on the basis of this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the following session and no one comes forward with the one-tenth increase, the auction shall be immediately repeated at his own risk, based on the price that was awarded to him in the previous session. In this session, no bid shall be considered unless it is accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder shall, in all cases, bear the fees for the transfer and registration of ownership, the execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law. Those initiating the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, and the Clerk's Department of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> shall bear no liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that he has inspected the property in a manner that negates any lack of knowledge.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement is published in the official gazette in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The judgment awarding the auction is subject to appeal within seven days from the date the judgment is pronounced, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states: "If the person whose property was expropriated is residing in the property, he shall remain therein as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder is obligated to issue a lease contract in his favor for a rent equivalent to that of similar properties."

Vice President of the Court of First Instance <orig>نائب رئيس المحكمة الكلية</orig>

# Ministry of Electricity and Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
## Announcement
### Tender No. (MEW / 4 - 2024 / 2025 (A))
The Ministry of Electricity and Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces a tender for the installation of instant coffee machines, beverage and drinking water dispensers, and foodstuff machines. Those wishing to participate can obtain the tender documents from the Contracts and Tenders Department – at the Ministry's main headquarters {South Surra – Sixth Ring Road – First Floor}.
This will be effective from Sunday, 28/9/2025, for a non-refundable fee of (50 K.D.) (only fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
For inquiries regarding any information about the tender, please contact Engineer / Hassan Al-Qallaf <orig>حسن القلاف</orig> at Tel: 66840044.
A preliminary meeting will be held on Tuesday, 14/10/2025, at 10:00 AM in the office of the Assistant Undersecretary for Administrative Affairs – Ground Floor of the Ministry. Bids must be submitted along with a certificate from the {Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>} stating the company's registration for the year (2025), and the company must be registered as a supplier with the Ministry's Procurement Department.
Bids shall be deposited in the designated box at the "Contracts and Tenders Department" at the Ministry's main headquarters {South Surra – Sixth Ring Road – First Floor} no later than 12:00 PM on Wednesday, 02/11/2025. Any bid received after the specified deadline will not be considered.

## Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>المجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>
### Announcement
The General Secretariat announces its desire to issue Practice No. (6-2025/2026) for the provision of an internal network protection system (FIREWALL SYSTEM) for the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development. Companies wishing to apply for this practice must observe the following:
1. Must be registered with the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig> and listed with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> before the issuance of this announcement.
2. The applying company must have experience in this field, with proof thereof.
3. The General Secretariat will begin distributing the practice conditions starting from the date of this announcement's publication for a period of ten working days.
4. The practice conditions can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department for a fee of KWD 75/- (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
5. A preliminary meeting will be held with the bidders on Wednesday, 1/10/2025, at 10:00 AM at the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning and Development <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط والتنمية</orig>.
6. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 9/10/2025.

# Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig>
## Amendment of Articles (19, 26) of the Articles of Association of the Kuwaiti Bowling Sporting Club <orig>نادي البولينغ الكويتي الرياضي</orig>
### Article (19)
The Board of Directors shall hold at least (8) ordinary meetings per year, with members attending in person or via video communication technology (ZOOM). The invitation shall be sent by the Secretary-General, in coordination with the Chairman of the Club's Board of Directors, at least (3) days before the meeting date. The invitation shall be accompanied by the session's agenda and the memoranda and reports related to the topics listed on this agenda, unless the Chairman of the Board of Directors deems it necessary to postpone and distribute any of them to the members at the time of the session. Its meetings shall be valid with the attendance of an absolute majority of its members. If this number is not met, the meeting shall be postponed to another session to be held within (7) days from the date of the first meeting. The Board's decisions shall be issued by a majority of the votes of those present. If the votes are tied, the side of the Chairman shall prevail, and the decisions shall be ratified at that time.
The club's administration shall keep a register to record the minutes of the Board's meetings, and the minutes of each session shall be signed by its chairman and the Secretary-General.
The Chairman may call the Board to meet outside its ordinary schedule whenever he deems it necessary, without being bound by the aforementioned dates. He must also call the Board to convene within (30) days if requested by a majority of the Board members. In all cases, the purpose of the meeting must be stated in the request.

### Article (26)
The Treasurer shall be responsible for the following:
a. Maintaining financial records, documents, and books.
b. Receiving funds due to the club and paying the required amounts according to the procedures approved by the Board of Directors.
c. Preparing the financial report for the concluded fiscal year and the draft budget for the upcoming year.
d. Presenting a statement on the club's financial position at every Board of Directors meeting or whenever requested by the Board.
e. Disbursing the salaries of the club's employees.
f. Maintaining a cash amount of (2000) dinars to cover periodic and urgent expenses.
g. Implementing the financial decisions of the Board of Directors.
((In the event of the Treasurer's absence due to illness or travel, the Assistant Treasurer shall assume his responsibilities.))

requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in exchange for its classification.

## Announcement 2025/102

Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces Tender 2025/2026/1 for the maintenance, installation, and modernization of automated attendance and departure systems and devices in Kuwait Municipality, in accordance with the general and special conditions and specifications contained in the aforementioned tender documents. These documents can be obtained from the Tenders and Contracts Department (Procurement Monitoring), main Municipality building (Middle Building) – Fourth Floor, for a non-refundable fee of 75 KWD (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
All companies submitting a bid for the tender must send a representative to attend the public session for opening the bid envelopes submitted for the tender. Please note that in case of non-compliance with attendance, the Municipality shall not bear any responsibility.
The deadline for depositing bids in the designated box at the Tenders and Contracts Department in the main Municipality – Minister's Building – Seventh Floor is exactly twelve o'clock noon on Monday, 13/10/2025. For inquiries, call 22401044.
Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of opening their envelopes. The value of the preliminary guarantee shall not be less than 2% of the total value, in the form of a certified (bank) check or a bank guarantee letter of credit in favor of Kuwait Municipality, valid for the entire duration of the bid's validity. Note that this tender is indivisible.

# Abdullah Al-Salem University <orig>جامعة عبدالله السالم</orig>
## Announcement of Practice No. 42/2025-2026
Supply, Installation, Operation, Maintenance, and Warranty of Solar Cell and Photosensor Laboratory Equipment

Abdullah Al-Salem University <orig>جامعة عبدالله السالم</orig> announces the issuance of (Practice) No. 42/2025-2026 concerning the supply, installation, operation, maintenance, and warranty of solar cell and photosensor laboratory equipment, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the (Practice Documents). These documents can be obtained from the Procurement and Warehousing Department at the university building (2 Kh – Ground Floor), Gate No. (3) in Al-Khaldiya <orig>الخالدية</orig>. Payment is to be made via K-Net. Bids must include an initial deposit, either as a letter of guarantee or a bank-certified check bearing the name of the bidding company or institution and naming Abdullah Al-Salem University <orig>جامعة عبدالله السالم</orig> as the beneficiary. A national labor support certificate must be attached to the bids; otherwise, the bid will be considered void.

## Announcement of Practice No. 44/2025-2026

Minutes of the Supreme Procurement Committee Meeting No. (105/2025) held on 17/9/2025

The Supreme Procurement Committee for Tenders of the Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries held its meeting at 12:30 PM on Wednesday, in the city of Al-Ahmadi <orig>مدينة الأحمدي</orig>, in the meeting hall at the Guesthouse <orig>بيت الضيافة</orig>, after the quorum was complete and in the presence of the esteemed members of the Committee, the Secretariat, and representatives from the concerned authorities..

## Meeting Proceedings
The Chairman commenced the meeting by welcoming the attendees, then he and the esteemed members reviewed the items on the agenda as follows: -

### Item One: -
The minutes of the previous Committee meeting No. (104/2025) held on 16/9/2025 were approved.

### Item Two: -
The attendance of the esteemed Committee members for the upcoming Committee meeting No. (106/2025) was recorded, and it was confirmed that a legal quorum for its convening is present.

3. The maintenance period for the works is (two years), commencing from the date of issuance of the final acceptance certificate, in accordance with Article (24) of the Special Conditions.
4. Bidders for this practice must be Kuwaiti—whether an individual or a company—registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>. Proof of this must be submitted via a recent certificate contemporary to the year the practice is issued. The bidder must have no less than five years of experience and must attach a table detailing their practical experience, supported by certified documents, records, and papers in the field of the practice's works. Failure to provide such proof will result in the bid's disqualification.
5. # Kuwait Airways Corporation
## A Kuwaiti Shareholding Company
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Kuwait Airways Corporation – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company – held its extraordinary meeting at ten o'clock in the morning on Tuesday, September 02, 2025, at the company's headquarters located in the Al-Farwaniya <orig>الفروانية</orig> area – Al-Dhajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig> – Kuwait Airways Main Building – Ground Floor – The Company's Grand Meeting Hall. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Abdulmohsen Salem Al-Fagaan <orig>عبدالمحسن سالم الفقعان</orig> in his capacity as Chairman of the Board of Directors.

The meeting was also attended by: -
*   Kuwait Airways Corporation
    Mr. Abdulwahab Ibrahim Al-Shatti <orig>عبدالوهاب إبراهيم الشطي</orig> – Acting Chief Executive Officer
    Mr. Ahmed Abdullah Al-Salem <orig>أحمد عبدالله السالم</orig> – Director of the Legal Department
    Mrs. Nadeen Salem Al-Rashed <orig>ندين سالم الراشد</orig> – Acting Director of the Finance Department
    Mrs. Amani Yaseen Bourayee <orig>اماني ياسين بورييع</orig> – Head of the Foreign Affairs Coordination and Follow-up Office
    Mr. Mohammed Bouish Al-Saeedi <orig>محمد بويش السعيدي</orig> – Acting Secretary of the Board of Directors
*   Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> (owner of all company shares)
    Mr. Khaled Abdulmohsen Al-Tharban <orig>خالد عبدالمحسن الذربان</orig>
    Mr. Hamad Dhafer Al-Refaei <orig>حمد ظافر الرفاعي</orig>
*   Shareholders holding 9,776,180,000 shares, representing 100% of the company's total authorized capital of 9,776,180,000 shares, which is the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.

After announcing that the legal quorum <orig>النصاب القانوني</orig> for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was met, the Chairman of the meeting, Mr. Abdulmohsen Salem Al-Fagaan <orig>عبدالمحسن سالم الفقعان</orig>, opened the session by welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly. After reviewing the agenda, the following resolutions were passed:-

First: Approval and ratification were granted to write off a portion of the company's accumulated losses as of 31/12/2024, amounting to K.D. 300,000,000 (three hundred million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), by reducing the entire statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي القانوني</orig> by K.D. 6,039,000 (six million and thirty-nine thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) and reducing the paid-up capital by K.D. 293,961,000 (two hundred ninety-three million, nine hundred sixty-one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

Second: Approval and ratification were granted to increase the company's issued capital by K.D. 300,000,000 (three hundred million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), to be called up according to a payment schedule determined by the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.

Third: Approval was granted to amend the articles related to capital in the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> and the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>.

Text before amendment:
"The company's authorized capital is set at one billion two hundred million Kuwaiti Dinars (1,200 million Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into twelve billion shares (12,000 million shares), with a value of one hundred Kuwaiti Fils (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares.
The issued and fully paid-up capital is set at nine hundred seventy-seven million, six hundred eighteen thousand Kuwaiti Dinars (977.618 million Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into nine billion, seven hundred seventy-six million, one hundred eighty thousand shares (9,776.180 million shares), with a value of one hundred Kuwaiti Fils (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."

Text after amendment:
-"The company's authorized capital is set at one billion two hundred million Kuwaiti Dinars (1,200 million Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into twelve billion shares (12,000 million shares), with a value of one hundred Kuwaiti Fils (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."
-The issued capital is set at nine hundred eighty-three million, six hundred fifty-seven thousand Kuwaiti Dinars (983.657 million Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into nine billion, eight hundred thirty-six million, five hundred seventy thousand shares (9,836.570 million shares), with a value of one hundred Kuwaiti Fils (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares."
-The paid-up capital is set at six hundred eighty-three million, six hundred fifty-seven thousand Kuwaiti Dinars (683.657 million Kuwaiti Dinars), divided into six billion, eight hundred thirty-six million, five hundred seventy thousand shares (6,836.570 million shares), with a value of one hundred Kuwaiti Fils (100 Kuwaiti Fils) per share, and all shares are cash shares.".

At the end of the meeting, the Chairman, Mr. Abdulmohsen Salem Al-Fagaan <orig>عبدالمحسن سالم الفقعان</orig>, thanked the attendees and concluded the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting at 10:30 AM.
